* Make: Toshiba
* Model: 2100CDT

=== Current Issues ===

=== Hardware details ===
* Processor: AMD K6-2 400MHz
* HD: 4.3 GB
* Removable Media: CD-ROM, Floppy
* Wireless: None Built-in, Using D-Link DWL-650 v.M1
* Network: NA
* Modem:  Lucent Microelectronics 56k Winmodem (rev  01)
* Ports: USB v1.0 x1, 1x serial DB9, 1x serial PS/2 (Y adapter supported), parallel, SVGA out.
* Video: S3virge MX, 2MB - on PCI bus
* PCMCIA: 2 ports (2x Type I or Type II, or 1x 32-bit Cardbus)
* Extra Keys: None
* Sound:  ESS ES1978 Maestro 2E (rev 10) - PCI
* Input: Built-in keyboard, Built-in "Accu Point" pointing device
* Memory: 192MB, 64MB default with 128MB add-on

==== Notes ====
* [1] On initial install, only one resolution is available - 640x480. This is alleviated by adding correct refresh rates to xorg.conf. Resolutions detected are 1024x768, 800x600 and 640x480. 2100CDT's internal display only supports 1024x768 as a "virtual display mode", 800x600 (full screen - proper), 640x480 (box in center of screen). 
* [2] After editing xorg.conf. Mine currently set to 31.5-64.3 hsync, 50-90 vsync. Also works fine @ 800x600 with 28-51 hsync, 50-70 vsync.
* [3] Works, but it mirrors.

* [4] Sounds looped/PC Card not seen. Fixed by changing BIOS setting for "PC Card - Controller Mode (on page 2) from "Auto-selected" to "Cardbus/16-bit". r818x driver works (well) out of the box!! - more below 

==== Additional Notes ====
* "Toshset" works fine.
* Driver module for the Realtek RTL8180 chip + sa2400/max2820/grf5101 frontends is available <nowiki>[[http://rtl8180-sa2400.sourceforge.net/|here]]</nowiki>. This is the driver module that works with my DWL-650 v.M1 (rtl8180 chip + Phillips sa2400 frontend). 
* 2100CDT specs can be found <nowiki>[[http://cdgenp01.csd.toshiba.com//content/product/pdf_files/detailed_specs/satellite_2100cdt.pdf|here]]</nowiki>(pdf).   
* r818x driver works (well!) out of the box! Not only is it much better than ndiswrapper, it seems to work even better than when I compiled it under hoary and breezy. Awesome!
